questions.question: Which of the following represents a sample statistic?
questions.chosen_answer: Population mean
questions.correct_answer: Sample mean
choices: Sample mean
Population mean
Population variance
Population standard deviation

questions.question: What does a p-value less than 0.05 typically indicate in hypothesis testing?
questions.chosen_answer: Fail to reject the null hypothesis
questions.correct_answer: Reject the null hypothesis
choices: Reject the null hypothesis
Fail to reject the null hypothesis
The test is inconclusive
The null hypothesis is true

questions.question: Which of the following distributions is used to model the number of occurrences of an event in a fixed interval of time or space?
questions.chosen_answer: Binomial distribution
questions.correct_answer: Poisson distribution
choices: Poisson distribution
Normal distribution
Binomial distribution
Exponential distribution

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of central tendency?
questions.chosen_answer: Standard deviation
questions.correct_answer: Median
choices: Median
Variance
Standard deviation
Interquartile range

questions.question: The F-distribution is used in which type of test?
questions.chosen_answer: Z-test
questions.correct_answer: ANOVA
choices: ANOVA
Z-test
T-test
Chi-square test

questions.question: What is the mean of a standard normal distribution?
choices: It depends on the data

questions.question: What does the R-squared value in a regression analysis represent?
questions.chosen_answer: The slope of the regression line
questions.correct_answer: The proportion of the variance in the dependent variable explained by the independent variable
choices: The slope of the regression line
The proportion of the variance in the dependent variable explained by the independent variable
The standard error of the estimate
The strength of the linear relationship

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a normal distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: It is skewed to the right
questions.correct_answer: It is symmetric
choices: It is symmetric
It is skewed to the left
It is skewed to the right
It is uniform

questions.question: In a hypothesis test, if the p-value is greater than the significance level, what is the appropriate conclusion?
questions.chosen_answer: Reject the null hypothesis
questions.correct_answer: Fail to reject the null hypothesis
choices: Reject the null hypothesis
Fail to reject the null hypothesis
The result is significant
There is a Type I error

questions.question: What is the mode of a data set?
questions.chosen_answer: The arithmetic average of the data
questions.correct_answer: The most frequent value in the data set
choices: The most frequent value in the data set
The arithmetic average of the data
The middle value when the data is ordered
The square root of the variance

questions.question: Which of the following represents a positively skewed distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: The tail is to the left
questions.correct_answer: The tail is to the right
choices: The tail is to the right
The tail is to the left
It is symmetric
There is no tail

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a t-distribution as the sample size increases?
questions.chosen_answer: The distribution becomes more skewed
questions.correct_answer: The distribution approaches a normal distribution
choices: The distribution becomes more skewed
The distribution approaches a normal distribution
The distribution becomes more spread out
The mean decreases

questions.question: Which of the following is a non-parametric test?
questions.chosen_answer: T-test
questions.correct_answer: Mann-Whitney U test
choices: Mann-Whitney U test
T-test
ANOVA
Z-test

questions.question: What is a point estimate?
questions.chosen_answer: The range of values that likely includes a population parameter
questions.correct_answer: A single value estimate for a population parameter
choices: A single value estimate for a population parameter
The range of values that likely includes a population parameter
The difference between two sample statistics
A probability distribution for sample means

questions.question: In a chi-square test, what does a large chi-square statistic indicate?
questions.chosen_answer: The observed frequencies are close to the expected frequencies
questions.correct_answer: There is a large difference between observed and expected frequencies
choices: There is a large difference between observed and expected frequencies
The observed frequencies are close to the expected frequencies
The sample size is too small
The test is inconclusive

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a discrete random variable?
questions.chosen_answer: Height
questions.correct_answer: Number of heads in a coin toss
choices: Number of heads in a coin toss
Weight
Height
Temperature

questions.question: What is the purpose of a confidence interval?
questions.chosen_answer: To estimate the probability of a sample statistic
questions.correct_answer: To provide a range of values that likely contains the population parameter
choices: To provide a range of values that likely contains the population parameter
To estimate the probability of a sample statistic
To test a hypothesis
To calculate the mean of a sample

questions.question: In a normal distribution, what percentage of the data falls within two standard deviations of the mean?
What is the main difference between parametric and non-parametric tests?
questions.chosen_answer: Parametric tests are based on means, while non-parametric tests are based on medians
questions.correct_answer: Parametric tests assume a specific distribution for the data, while non-parametric tests do not
choices: Parametric tests assume a specific distribution for the data, while non-parametric tests do not
Parametric tests are based on means, while non-parametric tests are based on medians
Parametric tests are used for small sample sizes, while non-parametric tests are used for large sample sizes
Non-parametric tests are more accurate than parametric tests

questions.question: What does the term 'power' refer to in the context of hypothesis testing?
questions.chosen_answer: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
questions.correct_answer: The probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false
choices: The probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false
The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
The probability of failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is true
The probability of a Type I error

questions.question: What does the standard error measure?
questions.chosen_answer: The variance of the population
questions.correct_answer: The standard deviation of the sampling distribution of a statistic
choices: The standard deviation of the sampling distribution of a statistic
The variance of the population
The average deviation from the mean
The confidence interval width

questions.question: What does a right-tailed test imply?
questions.chosen_answer: The critical region is in the left tail of the distribution
questions.correct_answer: The critical region is in the right tail of the distribution
choices: The critical region is in the right tail of the distribution
The critical region is in the left tail of the distribution
The test does not have a critical region
The test is two-tailed

questions.question: What is a common use of a chi-square test?
questions.chosen_answer: To test for differences between means
questions.correct_answer: To test for independence between categorical variables
choices: To test for independence between categorical variables
To test for differences between means
To test for relationships between two continuous variables
To estimate a population mean

questions.question: Which of the following tests is used to compare the means of two related groups?
questions.chosen_answer: Independent t-test
questions.correct_answer: Paired t-test
choices: Paired t-test
Independent t-test
ANOVA
Z-test

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of variability?
questions.chosen_answer: Mean
questions.correct_answer: Variance
choices: Variance
Mean
Median
Mode

questions.question: Which of the following is not a requirement of a binomial experiment?
questions.chosen_answer: The probability of success changes with each trial
questions.correct_answer: The probability of success changes with each trial
choices: The probability of success changes with each trial
The experiment consists of a fixed number of trials
Each trial has two possible outcomes
The trials are independent

questions.question: Which of the following is used to measure the strength and direction of a linear relationship between two variables?
questions.chosen_answer: The mean
questions.correct_answer: The correlation coefficient
choices: The correlation coefficient
The mean
The variance
The mode

questions.question: What does the law of large numbers state?
questions.chosen_answer: As sample size increases, the standard deviation decreases
questions.correct_answer: As sample size increases, the sample mean approaches the population mean
choices: As sample size increases, the sample mean approaches the population mean
As sample size increases, the standard deviation decreases
As sample size increases, the sample median approaches the population median
As sample size increases, the variance decreases

questions.question: What is a random variable?
questions.chosen_answer: A variable that takes on any value
questions.correct_answer: A variable that takes on values determined by chance
choices: A variable that takes on values determined by chance
A variable that takes on any value
A variable that takes on only positive values
A variable that remains constant

questions.question: Which of the following is true of a discrete probability distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: It represents continuous outcomes
questions.correct_answer: It represents the probability of each outcome for a discrete random variable
choices: It represents the probability of each outcome for a discrete random variable
It represents continuous outcomes
It has an infinite number of possible outcomes
It must have a mean of zero

questions.question: What does the z-score represent in a standard normal distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: The number of standard deviations an observation is from the mean
questions.correct_answer: The number of standard deviations an observation is from the mean
choices: The number of standard deviations an observation is from the mean
The probability of an event occurring
The mean of the data set
The range of the data set

questions.question: What is the difference between a one-tailed and a two-tailed test?
questions.chosen_answer: A one-tailed test has two critical regions, while a two-tailed test has only one
questions.correct_answer: A one-tailed test has one critical region, while a two-tailed test has two
choices: A one-tailed test has one critical region, while a two-tailed test has two
A one-tailed test has two critical regions, while a two-tailed test has only one
A one-tailed test is used for smaller sample sizes
There is no difference between the two tests

questions.question: What is the purpose of a residual in regression analysis?
questions.chosen_answer: To measure the accuracy of the slope
questions.correct_answer: To measure the difference between observed and predicted values
choices: To measure the difference between observed and predicted values
To measure the accuracy of the slope
To calculate the confidence interval
To estimate the standard error

questions.question: What does an outlier represent in a data set?
questions.chosen_answer: A value close to the mean
questions.correct_answer: A value that is significantly different from other values in the data set
choices: A value that is significantly different from other values in the data set
A value close to the mean
A value close to the median
A value equal to the mode

questions.question: What does the term 'degrees of freedom' refer to in statistics?
questions.chosen_answer: The number of independent data points in a data set
questions.correct_answer: The number of independent data points used in a calculation
choices: The number of independent data points used in a calculation
The number of independent data points in a data set
The sample size
The number of variables in a data set

questions.question: What does a negatively skewed distribution look like?
questions.chosen_answer: The tail is on the right side
questions.correct_answer: The tail is on the left side
choices: The tail is on the left side
The tail is on the right side
It is symmetric
There is no tail

questions.question: Which of the following represents the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false?
questions.chosen_answer: Type I error
questions.correct_answer: Power of the test
choices: Power of the test
Type I error
Type II error
Significance level

questions.question: What is a scatter plot used for?
questions.chosen_answer: To test a hypothesis
questions.correct_answer: To visualize the relationship between two variables
choices: To visualize the relationship between two variables
To test a hypothesis
To compare sample means
To calculate the correlation coefficient

questions.question: What does homoscedasticity refer to in regression analysis?
questions.chosen_answer: The linearity of the relationship between variables
questions.correct_answer: The assumption that the variance of residuals is constant across all levels of the independent variable
choices: The assumption that the variance of residuals is constant across all levels of the independent variable
The linearity of the relationship between variables
The absence of multicollinearity
The normality of the residuals

questions.question: What does the null hypothesis typically state?
questions.chosen_answer: There is a relationship between variables
questions.correct_answer: There is no relationship between variables
choices: There is no relationship between variables
There is a relationship between variables
The sample mean is greater than the population mean
The sample mean is less than the population mean

questions.question: What is multicollinearity?
questions.chosen_answer: The absence of a linear relationship between variables
questions.correct_answer: A condition where independent variables in a regression model are highly correlated
choices: A condition where independent variables in a regression model are highly correlated
The absence of a linear relationship between variables
The variance of the residuals is constant
The presence of outliers in the data

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a large sample size in hypothesis testing?
questions.chosen_answer: It increases the Type II error rate
questions.correct_answer: It reduces the standard error
choices: It reduces the standard error
It increases the Type II error rate
It increases the p-value
It reduces the test power

questions.question: What is the relationship between sample size and margin of error in confidence intervals?
questions.chosen_answer: As sample size increases, the margin of error increases
questions.correct_answer: As sample size increases, the margin of error decreases
choices: As sample size increases, the margin of error decreases
As sample size increases, the margin of error increases
There is no relationship
As sample size increases, the margin of error remains the same

questions.question: What does a two-tailed test imply?
questions.chosen_answer: The critical region is only on one side of the distribution
questions.correct_answer: The critical region is on both sides of the distribution
choices: The critical region is on both sides of the distribution
The critical region is only on one side of the distribution
The test is more powerful
The sample size is small

questions.question: What is the purpose of a random sample?
questions.chosen_answer: To minimize bias in the selection process
questions.correct_answer: To minimize bias in the selection process
choices: To minimize bias in the selection process
To maximize variability in the sample
To reduce the sample size
To ensure equal sample means

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the exponential distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: It is symmetric
questions.correct_answer: It models the time between events in a Poisson process
choices: It models the time between events in a Poisson process
It is symmetric
It is discrete
It has a constant variance

questions.question: What does a high standard deviation in a data set imply?
questions.chosen_answer: The data points are closely clustered around the mean
questions.correct_answer: The data points are spread out from the mean
choices: The data points are spread out from the mean
The data points are closely clustered around the mean
The data is normally distributed
The data is skewed

questions.question: Which of the following is true for a uniform distribution?
questions.chosen_answer: All outcomes have different probabilities
questions.correct_answer: All outcomes have the same probability
choices: All outcomes have the same probability
All outcomes have different probabilities
The distribution is skewed to the right
The distribution has a mean of zero

questions.question: What is the goal of stratified random sampling?
questions.chosen_answer: To divide the population into clusters
questions.correct_answer: To divide the population into subgroups and sample from each subgroup
choices: To divide the population into subgroups and sample from each subgroup
To divide the population into clusters
To select every nth member of the population
To maximize bias in the sample

questions.question: What is the null hypothesis in a chi-square goodness-of-fit test?
questions.chosen_answer: The observed distribution is different from the expected distribution
questions.correct_answer: The observed distribution is the same as the expected distribution
choices: The observed distribution is the same as the expected distribution
The observed distribution is different from the expected distribution
The observed frequencies are too large
The sample size is too small
